intro: Carex oederi f. alpestris, commonly known as the alpine sedge, is a variant of the Carex oederi species. It is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. This plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered spikelets. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in alpine or subalpine environments. The botanical features of Carex oederi f. alpestris make it well adapted to cold, high-altitude conditions.
